intro: Echinops taftanicus, commonly known as the Taftan thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly Iran and Afghanistan. The plant is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and spherical, blue-gray flower heads that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Echinops taftanicus is often used in xeriscaping due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
